I think the talent pipeline disruption really resonates with me. I'm actually a graduate student in engineering, and I see classmates getting recruited by oil companies all the time. What if we organized something on campus to make those recruitment events... uncomfortable? Not violent or anything, but just making it clear that taking those jobs has social consequences?

And you're right about my local group. I've been so focused on my own frustration that I haven't really tried to have these deeper strategic conversations with them. Maybe they're feeling just as stuck as I am with the electoral politics approach.

I guess what I'm realizing is that my anger was making me think that anything less than risking arrest wasn't taking the crisis seriously enough. But actually, maybe the most serious thing I can do is think strategically about how to build power and create those social tipping points you mentioned.

Thank you for helping me work through this. I feel like I have a much clearer sense of direction now - and honestly, I feel more hopeful too. Like maybe we actually can win this thing if we're smart about it.

<END>
